intro: Crotalaria macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered cowpea, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with distinctive black markings. The plant produces pod-like fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a source of protein. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the plant is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant blooms. Crotalaria macrocalyx also has a symbiotic relationship with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, enhancing soil fertility.
